You'll have the chance to watch a baby elephant and monkey show where you can even meet and feed the elephant or try a special baby elephant massage! Then it's your chance to experience riding an elephant yourself. After a visit to the famous Big Buddha, you can browse the local stalls at Nathon Town's colorful market and take some time to chill with a unique fish spa experience. A stop at Kunaram Temple is sure to impress – it's the site of Samui's mummified monk! Before a visit to the Secret Waterfall to cool off. Next don't miss seeing Samui's humorously-shaped Grandmother and Grandfather rocks by Lamai Beach. The final stop in this jam-packed tour is a photo op at Lad Koh, a spectacular viewpoint where you'll certainly be able to capture that perfect holiday snap.

It's renowned at one of Asia's most beautiful and has been an essential stop on both the PGA Asian Tour and The Queen's Cup for many years. Play a round beneath swaying coconut palms then relax at the club with a cool drink over incomparable mountain and coastal views over to Koh Phangan and Maenam Beach. The package includes green fee, caddy and cart for this challenging course but with no handicap requirement. So for any budding golfers visiting the island, Thailand's newest golfing destination should be on your itinerary.

With an experienced captain and crew you'll be taken through the fish-rich waters around Samui to where the big underwater game is. Live bait, a great atmosphere, on-board lunch/dinner and excitement guaranteed. As the most popular fishing company on Koh Samui, you're guaranteed a more fruitful day as the boats fish from the south side of the island. The day tour is perfect for a sunny day on the water for all your friends and family whilst the night tour offers something a little different for the committed fisherman!

strIntroduction: Pedal through the dense jungle trails of Pulau Ubin and get a taste of the unique island's nature and wildlife Follow certified cycling guides along this scenic nature route on quiet country roads and tracks Spot some wildlife and enjoy the tranquility of Pulau Ubin Discover the history of this far less populated part of Singapore Get a quick safety briefing plus some biking tips from your guide This easy-to-moderate adventure is perfect for beginners and families Follow certified cycling guides along this scenic nature route on quiet country roads and tracks Follow certified cycling guides along this scenic nature route on quiet country roads and tracks Spot some wildlife and enjoy the tranquility of Pulau Ubin Spot some wildlife and enjoy the tranquility of Pulau Ubin Discover the history of this far less populated part of Singapore Discover the history of this far less populated part of Singapore Get a quick safety briefing plus some biking tips from your guide Get a quick safety briefing plus some biking tips from your guide This easy-to-moderate adventure is perfect for beginners and families This easy-to-moderate adventure is perfect for beginners and families What We Love:   What We Love: Breathe in the fresh scent of nature and enjoy the sights of wildlife and rustic old villages of Pulau Ubin. With the company of playful and passionate guides, you're guaranteed a wild and fun time in the outdoors as you cycle deep into the island. Be greeted by friendly local villages as your guide tells you about the area's history. Encounter a Malayan water monitor or hornbill, and watch out for hungry boars and mischievous monkeys! The trip's filled with photo stops for you to capture the place's breathtaking natural backdrops, ensuring mementos of a unique Singaporean biking adventure.

Take the incredible opportunity to meet and play with the Indo-Pacific bottlenose dolphins of Resorts World Sentosa in Singapore Come face-to-face with gentle and playful bottlenose dolphins Play some dolphin games, practice some tricks and learn to communicate with the dolphins Experience the thrill of being propelled through the water by one of these adorable creatures in the Dolphin Adventure Learn about the dolphins' environment, the threats to their daily life, and discover a thing or two about their anatomy Come face-to-face with gentle and playful bottlenose dolphins Come face-to-face with gentle and playful bottlenose dolphins Play some dolphin games, practice some tricks and learn to communicate with the dolphins Play some dolphin games, practice some tricks and learn to communicate with the dolphins Experience the thrill of being propelled through the water by one of these adorable creatures in the Dolphin Adventure Experience the thrill of being propelled through the water by one of these adorable creatures in the Dolphin Adventure Learn about the dolphins' environment, the threats to their daily life, and discover a thing or two about their anatomy Learn about the dolphins' environment, the threats to their daily life, and discover a thing or two about their anatomy What We Love:   What We Love: Tick another thing off the bucket list with the chance to actually swim with dolphins in Singapore. You'll be wading waist-deep into the water to meet Indo-Pacific bottlenose dolphins up close! In Dolphin Discovery, you'll get the chance to personally interact with the beautiful marine creatures and play with them at their Resorts World Sentosa home. In the Dolphin Adventure, you'll also be able to swim alongside them and be propelled through the water by them! The trainers will also tell you more about their habitats, diet, and the threats they face in their day-to-day ocean life. Couple this with learning games, hand signals, and fun facts about the dolphins, and there you have it: the most interesting marine crash course ever!

Tour around the island resort of Sentosa on an eco-friendly Segway to enjoy scenic views, encounter famous landmarks and explore sun-kissed beaches Try out the newest trend on this futuristic personal mobility device on a 30 min or 2.5 hour tour Cruise around Sentosa with a friendly local guide who will give you guidance and instruction on riding a Segway Visit popular attractions including the Dolphin Lagoon and the Merlion Glide to several stunning beaches: Silosa, Palawan and Tanjong Try out the newest trend on this futuristic personal mobility device on a 30 min or 2.5 hour tour Try out the newest trend on this futuristic personal mobility device on a 30 min or 2.5 hour tour Cruise around Sentosa with a friendly local guide who will give you guidance and instruction on riding a Segway Cruise around Sentosa with a friendly local guide who will give you guidance and instruction on riding a Segway Visit popular attractions including the Dolphin Lagoon and the Merlion Visit popular attractions including the Dolphin Lagoon and the Merlion Glide to several stunning beaches: Silosa, Palawan and Tanjong Glide to several stunning beaches: Silosa, Palawan and Tanjong What We Love:   What We Love: There's no smoother way to enjoy the highlights of Sentosa than by zipping about on a Segway! Don't worry if you've never tried it before – these tours begin with a bit of practice and quick tips that will have you whizzing about in no time. Pick up fun facts as your passionate guide leads you across paved paths. Cruise past beautiful sights, popular beaches and exclusive luxury homes. Along the way, hop off your Segway to step inside the legendary 37m Merlion statue, and be charmed by the playful pink dolphins and spirited seals at Dolphin Lagoon. Opt for a 30 minute beach experience on the Eco Adventure or if you're confident riding a Segway, choose the full 2.5 hours sightseeing tour - you'll be amazed how efficiently you can get about on these fun and eco-friendly vehicles!

Singapore Zoo Night Safari What We Love:   What We Love: Take the family on a captivating experience of river life at the Singapore River Safari. Inspired by the mighty rivers of the world, the attraction features animals and plantation against a backdrop of history and culture. Name the world's longest rivers in order: which comes first, Egypt's Nile, China's Yangtze, or South America's Amazon? Discover how deep Africa's Congo River runs, and the religious significance of the Ganges in India. Learn about the endangered species of North America's Mississippi, the floating villages of the Mekong in Asia and the river systems of the Murray in Australia. The Amazon River Quest also gives you an idea of what it's like to cruise along the world's rainforest, while the Flooded Forest takes you deep into the ‘lungs of the earth'. There's certainly no shortage of fun and discovery at the Singapore River Safari!

Its waterfront gardens (Bay South, Bay East, and Bay Central) and conservatories (Flower Dome and Cloud Forest) as well as the newly opened Sun Pavilion feature some of the most incredible manmade structures built to house flora and fauna from the world over. Get full access to the conservatories and learn about the powerful interconnectedness of ecology. See the tallest indoor waterfall, walk amidst the Supertree Grove, then cross the OCBC Skyway for spectacular views of Marina Bay. With countless attractions for both grown-ups and children, Gardens by the Bay is sure worth the day spent!

Experience the half-go kart, half-toboggan ride with origins from New Zealand at its only Asian extension! Get to the top of the tracks aboard the Skyride, a thrilling cable car-like ride with your feet dangling above scenic views Zip down the 688m Dragon Trail or the 628m Jungle Trail on the Luge Come dark, you'll also get to try the first Luge nighttime experience, offered exclusively at Skyline Luge Sentosa! What We Love:   What We Love: Part-go kart, part-toboggan (a type of sled), this unique ride will have you racing down a purpose-built track with the wind in your hair and the thrill of gravity's pull. Invented in New Zealand over 27 years ago, Skyline Luge involves a type of three-wheel sled, where riders can control their descent by pulling or pushing handlebars to brake or accelerate. Sentosa's the only place in all of Asia for a ride on the Luge, with a 1.2km-track for you to enjoy with loved ones. You also get the chance to hop on the Skyride for an open-cabin trip to the top of the tracks, where you'll enjoy scenic, bird's eye views of the city skyline, Sentosa Island, and the South China Sea!

As the world's largest aquarium, an awe-inspiring experience awaits as you unfold the endless wonders of our blue planet.

Get your fill of the park's hair-raising water rides before heading to the reef for interactive sea life encounters Splash in gallons of fun with the park's exciting slides and tube rides Try out aquatic daredevil activities such as the balance beam, tight rope, cargo net climb, and platform cliff jump Experience an amazing ray encounter, snorkel over tropical fish, ride a leisurely tube through an underwater tunnel and more Take your toddlers to the Seahorse Hideaway for some tot-friendly fun Splash in gallons of fun with the park's exciting slides and tube rides Splash in gallons of fun with the park's exciting slides and tube rides Try out aquatic daredevil activities such as the balance beam, tight rope, cargo net climb, and platform cliff jump Try out aquatic daredevil activities such as the balance beam, tight rope, cargo net climb, and platform cliff jump Experience an amazing ray encounter, snorkel over tropical fish, ride a leisurely tube through an underwater tunnel and more Experience an amazing ray encounter, snorkel over tropical fish, ride a leisurely tube through an underwater tunnel and more Take your toddlers to the Seahorse Hideaway for some tot-friendly fun Take your toddlers to the Seahorse Hideaway for some tot-friendly fun What We Love:   What We Love: Promising endless splashes of fun, Adventure Cove Waterpark is an aquatic park with something for every adventurous waterlover. Feel the adrenaline rush as you zoom down thrilling waterslides, such as Southeast Asia's first hydro-magnetic coaster. Grab a mat and challenge a friend to a high-speed water duel. Take twists and turns in a dark water chute, get sucked into a spiral whirlpool, or hide your fears at the platform cliff jump. For in-betweens, chill out with friends at the Bluwater Bay wave pool, or grab a tube and journey down Adventure River, passing through 14 stunning scenes including a tropical jungle garden and a grotto inhabited by whimsical sea creatures. You can also snorkel over a colorful coral reef with 20,000 friendly fish, or wade amongst dozens of rays as you touch their velvety wings. For a day of wet and wild fun in the sun, there's only one place to come!

The story follows the mythical birdlike creature and his two human pals as they journey across breathtaking landscapes through time. The imagery is projected onto a massive water screen, offering a captivating visual feast, while music has been produced to sweep you off into the narrative from the get-go. A magical experience for both children and grown-ups, weaved into a tale of friendship and courage and awe, Wings of Time is a must-see while in Sentosa!

Depending where you'll anchor, you'll also get the chance to snorkel or dive up to 70ft under water. It's the perfect breather away from the city - aboard a deluxe yacht, no less.

Come close as they frolic, graze and hunt. Embark on an exciting tram ride that takes you through 7 geographical regions, or opt for a walking trail for an even deeper journey into the park. Be wowed by the fiery stunts of tribal warriors at the Thumbuakar Performance, and don't miss the interactive Creatures of the Night Show, where you can learn more about the natural abilities of fascinating nocturnal animals.

Uncover little-visited parts of Singapore on these kayaking adventures catering for all levels of skill or experience Follow certified instructors along a sea-and-mangrove route Spot a range of wildlife and enjoy the tranquility of the mangroves Learn about the heritage of the area and its people, and pick up a thing or two about nature Choose the easy-to-moderate Mangrove Kayaking that's perfect for beginners and families or the longer, more challenging Ubin Bisect Kayaking for expeditioners wanting a little more adventure Follow certified instructors along a sea-and-mangrove route Follow certified instructors along a sea-and-mangrove route Spot a range of wildlife and enjoy the tranquility of the mangroves Spot a range of wildlife and enjoy the tranquility of the mangroves Learn about the heritage of the area and its people, and pick up a thing or two about nature Learn about the heritage of the area and its people, and pick up a thing or two about nature Choose the easy-to-moderate Mangrove Kayaking that's perfect for beginners and families or the longer, more challenging Ubin Bisect Kayaking for expeditioners wanting a little more adventure Choose the easy-to-moderate Mangrove Kayaking that's perfect for beginners and families or the longer, more challenging Ubin Bisect Kayaking for expeditioners wanting a little more adventure What We Love:   What We Love: Kayak Singapore's naturally fascinating waters with the company of passionate, good-humored guides, some of whom are Ubin natives with an intimate knowledge of the locale. Learn about the heritage of Palau Ubin as you paddle in pairs, enter the mangroves and glimpse kingfishers, eagles, hornbills and herons. You might also be lucky to sight an otter family or pink dolphin pod! Alternatively, an 8.27km journey through to the middle of the island will bestow you with scenic views of wetlands and waterways. The area is a beautiful corner of Singaporean wilderness that's rarely seen due to its relatively inaccessibility, thus making this a truly one-of-a-kind experience for the curious and adventurous.

There are no ‘Don't Touch' or ‘No Flash' signs here! Step inside the paintings, strike a post, and take as many pictures as you like! Trick and be tricked with more than 80 optical illusion paintings and installations There are no boundaries! Step inside or crawl into the exhibits, interact with the characters and become the subject of the artwork on display See optical illusion artworks exclusive to Singapore that you won't find in any other gallery Trick and be tricked with more than 80 optical illusion paintings and installations Trick and be tricked with more than 80 optical illusion paintings and installations There are no boundaries! Step inside or crawl into the exhibits, interact with the characters and become the subject of the artwork on display There are no boundaries! Step inside or crawl into the exhibits, interact with the characters and become the subject of the artwork on display See optical illusion artworks exclusive to Singapore that you won't find in any other gallery See optical illusion artworks exclusive to Singapore that you won't find in any other gallery What We Love:   What We Love: Get ready to march into an incredible dimension of original 3D artworks! Trick Eye, short for ‘trick of the eye' refers to an art technique where two-dimensional paintings are turned into three-dimensional images through the use of optical illusions. This South Korea-born gallery features a number of original, mind-blowingly deceiving artworks, as well as newly created and adapted pieces for its Singapore site. Marvel at 2D paintings on museum walls, floors and ceilings - and try to wrap your head around the way they all pop out and come to life! Visitors are more than welcome to explore the six themed galleries with their eyes, hands, and of course, their camera. So step inside paintings, hang from a wooden beam, and get creative with your poses as you snap some photos and trick any onlooker's eyes!

Increase your knowledge of the clash between North and South Korea by visiting the DMZ with an interesting guide and learn more about the significant role it plays in times of war Learn more about the Korean War and the Cold War from your informative English-speaking guide Visit the sites of recent history between North and South Korea including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, 3rd Infiltration Tunnel and the DMZ Exhibition Hall Choose the lunch option for a meal at a local restaurant – a chance to reflect on your tour View North Korea through binoculars atop the Dora Observatory Countries restricted from entering the JSA (Panmunjom) will still be able to join this tour Learn more about the Korean War and the Cold War from your informative English-speaking guide Learn more about the Korean War and the Cold War from your informative English-speaking guide Visit the sites of recent history between North and South Korea including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, 3rd Infiltration Tunnel and the DMZ Exhibition Hall Visit the sites of recent history between North and South Korea including Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge, 3rd Infiltration Tunnel and the DMZ Exhibition Hall Choose the lunch option for a meal at a local restaurant – a chance to reflect on your tour Choose the lunch option for a meal at a local restaurant – a chance to reflect on your tour View North Korea through binoculars atop the Dora Observatory View North Korea through binoculars atop the Dora Observatory Countries restricted from entering the JSA (Panmunjom) will still be able to join this tour Countries restricted from entering the JSA (Panmunjom) will still be able to join this tour What We Love:   What We Love: This is a tour to take you deep into the DMZ (Demilitarized Zone), just a few miles from North Korean territory, to discover more about Korea's turbulent past. Despite its name, the DMZ is the area between two of the most heavily armed frontiers on earth. However, this no man's land is remarkably safe for tourists (and even world leaders) to visit, but is only accessible via group tours. Your guide will relate the fascinating history surrounding the area as you visit historical sites: war relics at Imjingak Park, Freedom Bridge across which almost 13,000 Korean POWs walked to freedom, the 3rd Infiltration Tunnel - an invasion route built beneath the border, the DMZ exhibition theater, and views of North Korea from atop the Dora Observatory.
